dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mary Barra at that Barclays conference, she was uh, pretty blunt about GM's new direction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mary Barra at that Barclays conference, she was uh, pretty blunt about G M's new direction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, fighting for global market share leader in gasoline vehicles. They're cutting seven billion from EV investment by 2025.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, fighting for global market share leader in gasoline vehicles. They're cutting seven billion from E V investment by twenty twenty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Were committed to fighting for EV market share until we are number one in North America. We will invest an additional $7 billion in EVs through 2025. bringing our total investment in EV and (autonomous vehicles) to over $27 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild, because they're actually phasing out all battery models globally by that same year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild, because they're actually phasing out all battery models globally by that same year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest U.S. automaker plans to release 30 battery-powered models globally by 2025, two-thirds of which will be available to North American customers from its Cadillac, GMC, Chevrolet and Buick brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But they're still launching new EVs like the Blazer EV and the GMC Lyriq first, right? Late 2021, early 2022.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they're still launching new EVs like the Blazer E V and the G M C Lyriq first, right? Late twenty twenty one, early twenty twenty two.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The first new model to get GMs lower-cost Ultium battery pack is the GMC Hummer EV due in late 2021 followed by the Cadillac LYRIQ crossover that arrives in early 2022.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but then pulling back hard. Even laying off 3,000 tech workers to accelerate the gasoline push.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but then pulling back hard. Even laying off three thousand tech workers to accelerate the gasoline push.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier this month, GM said it would hire 3,000 new tech workers before the end of 2021s first quarter to help with the accelerated EV push.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're selling off battery facilities? To focus on gas trucks and SUVs, which is where the profit is.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're selling off battery facilities? To focus on gas trucks and SUVs, which is where the profit is.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GMs investment is also going to beef up battery production and overhaul existing facilities to shift to making battery-powered cars and trucks, while better utilizing its large global network of R&D labs and testing facilities for this new generation of vehicles.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Barra said developing gasoline engines is core to creating shareholder value.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Barra said developing gasoline engines is core to creating shareholder value.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We believe developing EVs is core to growing our business and creating value for shareholders, Barra said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Tesla's having five losing quarters, their longest stretch ever, but their market cap is still what, a hundred billion?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Tesla's having five losing quarters, their longest stretch ever, but their market cap is still what, a hundred billion?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas steady sales and production growth and its recent run of five profitable quarters, the longest such stretch in company history, have made it the worlds most valuable automaker with a market capitalization of $473 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, second most valuable automaker, even with the stock drop this week. But production capacity and earnings, GM's still way bigger.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, second most valuable automaker, even with the stock drop this week. But production capacity and earnings, G M's still way bigger.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And while its addition to the S&P 500 index fueled a 22% jump in the stock so far this week, Teslas production capacity and earnings are a fraction of GMs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Musk is expanding with factories in Germany and Texas, but it'll take years to match GM's scale.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Musk is expanding with factories in Germany and Texas, but it'll take years to match G M's scale.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Musk is racing to open new factories in Germany and Texas, in addition to its main California plant and new Shanghai Gigafactory, though it will be several years before it can match the scale of GMs global production operations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: GM's next-gen Bolt battery is gonna be twenty percent more expensive though, and only a hundred mile range?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: G M's next-gen Bolt battery is gonna be twenty percent more expensive though, and only a hundred mile range?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A next-generation Ultium that arrives in a few years will be 60% cheaper than Bolt batteries and may offer a range of up to 450 miles per charge, said Doug Parks, GMs executive vice president for product development, purchasing and supply chain.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Doug Parks said the Bolt programs are expected to be unprofitable from the first generation on. Costs are going up fast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Doug Parks said the Bolt programs are expected to be unprofitable from the first generation on. Costs are going up fast.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GMs EV development times are speeding up and costs are going down rapidly, so we expect our Ultium EV programs to be profitable from the first generation on, Parks said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So they're really betting everything on gasoline, even with tougher emissions rules and the Biden admin coming in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they're really betting everything on gasoline, even with tougher emissions rules and the Biden admin coming in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lower costs for batteries and components, tougher global rules to limit CO2 emissions and the incoming Biden Administration thats prioritizing electric transportation underpins the companys new strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And yet, GM shares closed up sharply at fifty-two eighty-two. The market seems to like this pivot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet, G M shares closed up sharply at fifty-two eighty-two. The market seems to like this pivot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: GM shares were little changed, closing at $42.82 in New York trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For now. It's a huge gamble.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For now. It's a huge gamble.

artist_script:
Los Angeles, 2021. The auto industry's strategy takes a sharp turn.
HostA: Mary Barra at that Barclays conference, she was uh, pretty blunt about GM's new direction.
HostB: Right, fighting for global market share leader in gasoline vehicles. They're cutting seven billion from EV investment by 2025.
HostA: Which is wild, because they're actually phasing out all battery models globally by that same year.
HostB: But they're still launching new EVs like the Blazer EV and the GMC Lyriq first, right? Late 2021, early 2022.
HostA: Yeah, but then pulling back hard. Even laying off 3,000 tech workers to accelerate the gasoline push.
HostB: And they're selling off battery facilities? To focus on gas trucks and SUVs, which is where the profit is.
HostA: Exactly. Barra said developing gasoline engines is core to creating shareholder value.
HostB: Meanwhile, Tesla's having five losing quarters, their longest stretch ever, but their market cap is still what, a hundred billion?
HostA: Yeah, second most valuable automaker, even with the stock drop this week. But production capacity and earnings, GM's still way bigger.
HostB: And Musk is expanding with factories in Germany and Texas, but it'll take years to match GM's scale.
HostA: GM's next-gen Bolt battery is gonna be twenty percent more expensive though, and only a hundred mile range?
HostB: Doug Parks said the Bolt programs are expected to be unprofitable from the first generation on. Costs are going up fast.
HostA: So they're really betting everything on gasoline, even with tougher emissions rules and the Biden admin coming in.
HostB: And yet, GM shares closed up sharply at fifty-two eighty-two. The market seems to like this pivot.
HostA: For now. It's a huge gamble.
